worklogs.comment:
fsaintjacques commented on pull request #4398: ARROW-4990: [C++] Support Array-Array comparison
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4398
 
 
   Comparison was only support for the left argument to be an array and the right argument a scalar. This extends support for comparing two arrays, but also supporting the case where the left argument is a scalar and the right an array.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

emkornfield commented on pull request #4398: ARROW-4990: [C++] Support Array-Array comparison
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4398#discussion_r288882126
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/compute/kernels/filter.h
 ##########
 @@ -57,6 +79,13 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT FilterBinaryKernel : public BinaryKernel {
   Status Call(FunctionContext* ctx, const Datum& left, const Datum& right,
               Datum* out) override;
 
+  static int64_t out_length(const Datum& left, const Datum& right) {
+    if (left.kind() == Datum::ARRAY) return left.length();
+    if (right.kind() == Datum::ARRAY) return right.length();
+
+    return 0;
 
 Review comment:
   does it pay to support scalar-scalar comparison (i.e. should this be 1)?
